poem:
Title: Justice's Joust

In the court of the robed mourner,
Politics pirouettes on life's corner.
Furor unfurls like flags upside down,
Where the gavel seeks the weighty crown.

Racism's shadow stains the soil,
Campaigns clash in bitter turmoil.
On the set, slurs steep in scorn,
In the city, verdicts born. 

The theatre of justice never still,
Each chapter a fresh, unscripted thrill.
